citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC approved protocol TIPS-002 did not contain a rationale for the appropriateness of the numbers of animals to
be used. A rationale for animal numbers must be adequately explained in the protocol to allow the IACUC to complete a
thorough review of the protocol and to ensure animal numbers for the activity is appropriate. Failure to provide and review
this detail may result in an excess of animals used and euthanized. The registrant must ensure that all protocols contain
not only a rationale for involving animals and the appropriateness of the species, but also the rationale for the
appropriateness of the number of animals to be used.
Correct by 03/20/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.31(e)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC approved protocol TIPS-002 did not contain a rationale for the appropriateness of the numbers of animals to 
be used.  A rationale for animal numbers must be adequately explained in the protocol to allow the IACUC to complete a 
thorough review of the protocol and to ensure animal numbers for the activity is appropriate. Failure to provide and review 
this detail may result in an excess of animals used and euthanized. The registrant must ensure that all protocols contain 
not only a rationale for involving animals and the appropriateness of the species, but also the rationale for the 
appropriateness of the number of animals to be used. 
 
Correct by 03/20/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
End Section
